headline: Exxon Slashes 2,000 Jobs. Why the Oil Giant Made the Move Now.
summary: Exxon Mobil  is planning to slash about 2,000 jobs, a spokesperson for the oil major confirmed to Barron’s Tuesday.  The job cuts represent 3% to 4% of the energy company’s global workforce.  “Our global office network was established decades ago under very different circumstances,” Exxon said in a statement.

headline: Spotify CEO resigns, CoreWeave & Meta, Exxon: Trending tickers
summary: Morning Brief host Julie Hyman takes a look at some of Tuesday morning's trending tickers and stories. Spotify (SPOT) CEO Daniel Ek has stepped down as chief executive. He will be succeeded by Gustav Söderström and Alex Norström as co-CEOs. Exxon (XOM) is reportedly planning to lay off 2,000 employees, according to Bloomberg. CoreWeave (CRWV) signed a deal to supply Meta (META) with computing power. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Exxon Mobil to cut 2,000 jobs globally amid restructuring
summary: The layoffs represent about 3% to 4% of the company's global workforce and are part of an ongoing efficiency drive, according to Bloomberg News, which first reported the news earlier on Tuesday.  Exxon Mobil has been streamlining its operations after closing its $60 billion purchase of Pioneer Natural Resources in 2024.  On Monday, Canadian shale producer Imperial Oil, in which Exxon is a major shareholder, announced plans to cut 20% of its workforce and shutter business in Calgary.

raw.headline: Exxon Mobil to cut 2,000 jobs globally amid restructuring
raw.summary: The layoffs represent about 3% to 4% of the company's global workforce and are part of an ongoing efficiency drive, according to Bloomberg News, which first reported the news earlier on Tuesday.  Exxon Mobil has been streamlining its operations after closing its $60 billion purchase of Pioneer Natural Resources in 2024.  On Monday, Canadian shale producer Imperial Oil, in which Exxon is a major shareholder, announced plans to cut 20% of its workforce and shutter business in Calgary.

headline: Exxon to Cut 2,000 Jobs in Global Restructuring
summary: The reductions represent about 3% to 4% of Exxon’s global workforce and are part of the company’s ongoing efficiency drive, Chief Executive Officer Darren Woods said in an memo to employees Tuesday.  Calgary-based Imperial Oil Ltd., which is nearly 70% owned by Exxon, announced Monday it is cutting 20% of its workforce.  Chevron Corp., ConocoPhillips and BP Plc are among major oil companies to have also announced thousands of job cuts in recent months as crude prices tumbled this year in response to increased supplies from OPEC and its allies.
